CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 13 - Right to an effective remedy;Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Khanlar Hajiyev
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . As a victim of GPE , the applicant was entitled to social beneﬁts . Considering himself underpaid , he brought CARDINAL actions against a social - security authority .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held for the applicant and ordered the authority to pay arrears and to increase the periodic payments . This judgment became binding on DATE . According to the Government , this judgment was gradually enforced by DATE . According to the applicant , this judgment has not been fully enforced to date , because the periodic payments lag behind the cost of living .

CARDINAL . On DATE the town court held for the applicant and ordered the authority to pay MONEY ( RUB ) in arrears and to upgrade the periodic payments to RUB CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL with their subsequent adjustment for the cost - of - living . This judgment became binding on DATE , but has not been fully enforced to date .
CARDINAL . Under LAW of DATE , a bailiff must enforce a judgment in DATE . Under section QUANTITY of LAW of DATE , ORG must enforce a judgment in DATE .
